TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit EndpointIdentity extends System.Object

Docs.summary: An abstract class that when implemented provides an identity that enables the authentication of an endpoint by clients that exchange messages with it.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the identity for an endpoint can be set with constructors of <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress>, where its value can also be accessed as a read-only <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress.Identity%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity CreateDnsIdentity(string dnsName) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateDnsIdentity (dnsName As String) As EndpointIdentity

Docs.param: The name for the DNS identity.
Docs.summary: Creates a DNS identity with a specified DNS name.
Docs.returns: A DNS associated with the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A secure WCF client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain a DNS claim that represents this identity.
This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.DnsEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor <xref:System.ServiceModel.DnsEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity CreateIdentity(class System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim identity) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateIdentity (identity As Claim) As EndpointIdentity

Docs.param: A used to create the new identity.
Docs.summary: Creates an identity with the specified claim.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A secure WCF client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain the identity claim used to construct this identity.
This method can create an identity of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.DnsEndpointIdentity>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.SpnEndpointIdentity>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.UpnEndpointIdentity>, or <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity>.
## Examples The following code shows how to call this method.
[!code-csharp[S_UEEndpointIdentity#42](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueendpointidentity/cs/source.cs#42)]

## Remarks A secure WCF client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain a claim that contains the RSA public key used to construct this identity.
One of these static methods creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A secure WCF client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain a claim that contains the RSA public key obtained from the certificate used to construct this identity.
This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity CreateSpnIdentity(string spnName) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateSpnIdentity (spnName As String) As EndpointIdentity

Docs.param: The name for the SPN identity.
Docs.summary: Creates a server principal name (SPN) identity with a specified name.
Docs.returns: An SPN associated with the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A secure WCF client that connects to an endpoint with this identity uses the SPN when performing SSPI authentication with the endpoint.
This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.SpnEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.SpnEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>, using `spnName` as the input parameter.
If `spnName` is specified with an empty string, authentication falls back from Kerberos to NTLM if possible. If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WindowsClientCredential.AllowNtlm%2A> is `false`, authentication fails.
## Examples The following code shows how to call this method.
[!code-csharp[S_UEEndpointIdentity#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueendpointidentity/cs/source.cs#12)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity CreateUpnIdentity(string upnName) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateUpnIdentity (upnName As String) As EndpointIdentity

Docs.param: The name for the UPN identity.
Docs.summary: Creates a user principal name (UPN) identity with a specified name.
Docs.returns: A UPN associated with the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A secure WCF client that connects to an endpoint with this identity uses the UPN when performing SSPI authentication with the endpoint.
This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.UpnEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.UpnEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>, using `upnName` as the input parameter.
If `upnName` is specified with an empty string, authentication falls back from Kerberos to NTLM if possible. If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WindowsClientCredential.AllowNtlm%2A> is `false`, WCF makes a best-effort to throw an exception if NTLM is used. Note that setting this property to `false` may not prevent NTLM credentials from being sent over the wire.
## Examples The following code shows how to call this method.
[!code-csharp[S_UEEndpointIdentity#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ueendpointidentity/cs/source.cs#30)]

## Remarks Choose between these two constructors based on whether you have supporting certificates.
A secure WCF client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain the claim that contains the thumbprint of the certificate used to construct this identity.
